intro: Pouteria cyclopensis, commonly known as the cyclops nut or the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The tree produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that develop into large, woody fruits containing a single, large, kidney-shaped seed. The seed, often referred to as the "Brazil nut," is rich in nutrients and has a high oil content. Pouteria cyclopensis plays a significant ecological role in its habitat, supporting a variety of wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of the rainforest.
